availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Marshall, Sr. (Henderson County, Kentucky, planter)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, planter. Henderson County native. Married to Lucy F. Posey Marshall on February 22, 1853. Father of Posey Marshall, William J. Marshall, Jr., Eliza J. Marshall, Starling Marshall, and Anna D. Marshall. Store clerk in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned twenty-four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, District 1, p. 271; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Division 1, p. 144; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Division 1, p. 147; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Ward 2, p. 3; Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Marriages, Henderson County, Kentucky, February 22, 1853.
